Key preference export

Looks like a win32 issue as I don't have 1089 lines in my Linux/GTK+ source code. ;)

This is what I see in MenuItem on line 1089 in the win32 SWT:
if (!success) error (SWT.ERROR_CANNOT_SET_TEXT);

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.swt/Eclipse%20SWT/win32/org/eclipse/swt/widgets/MenuItem.java?revision=1.97&view=markup

What's interesting is that the error log shows that the exception was caused by the closing of the dialog.

Philippe, do you get this error if you click OK instead of Cancel (since the stack trace shows cancelPressed())? Do you get this if you just fire up the preference dialog and then close it without ever going into the keys page?
Actually, I don't get it any longer. Checking deeper in the .log, I discovered SWT "no more handle" errors... so chances are that these caused the pref page to misbehave (unfortunately I lost my log file since then), and then the exception I mentioned earlier was an issue only when closing the page.

I'll assume it's the No More Handles problem for now as I'm not able to reproduce it.

Philippe, please re-open this if it happens again.

PW
